When it comes to day-to-day hygiene, showering and applying perfume are just two parts of the puzzle. When the going gets tough, you need something to keep sweat at bay, and you need it daily. That’s where the best long-lasting men’s deodorants come in.

Whether you’re a gym bunny or you just have a long working day ahead of you, a good deodorant stick or spray can go a long way. Even if you’re just leaning back in your office chair all day, you’re bound to work up a funk sooner or later.

Luckily, with the deodorants we’ve picked out for you, you have nothing to worry about in that department. At the end of the day, these puppies just plain smell amazing. Even if you don’t tend to sweat a lot, an extra layer of minty or woodsy freshness couldn’t possibly hurt.

Without further ado, here are the best long-lasting men’s deodorants.

Key Takeaways

Thanks to my mom, I’m no stranger to deodorant. But on this quest for the best long-lasting men’s deodorants, it was important for me to freshen up my knowledge. I reviewed big and small brands, read customer reviews, and perused my own bathroom cabinet.

For me, Harry’s Men’s Deodorant tops the list of the best long-lasting men’s deodorants out there. All three scents are amazing, and it offers some really impressive perspiration control. You can even get it aluminum-free to prevent staining your clothes.

For sportier guys, the Old Spice Endurance package is an amazing investment. It offers that trademark Old Spice scent, and it does a great job at combating sweat while you’re lifting at the gym.

Best Overall: Harry’s Men’s Deodorant

Why it’s great: Harry’s is the pinnacle of the best long-lasting men’s deodorants and one of the best male deodorants, period. From its cruelty-free production to the incredible scents, everything about this product and its maker is top-shelf.

The redwood one is a staple, and the fig-scented one is one of the most unique-smelling (in a good way!) products I’ve ever used.

Who is this for? Anyone can use Harry’s deodorant, especially since it comes in three different kinds. You can order an aluminum-free stick to combat stains or one of two antiperspirant picks with varying durations.

There’s nothing this stuff can’t do, and you can get a pretty sweet three-for-one deal to mix and match.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: As amazing as the scents are, they’re a bit on the subtle side. That’s how all good deodorants should work, if you ask me, but keep in mind there are stronger-smelling picks on this list.

Type: Stick | Scent: Redwood, shiso, stone, fig | Size: 2.5 oz | Benefit: Cruelty-free, aluminum-free | Features: Sweat control

Best Budget: Degree UltraClear Men’s Deodorant

Why it’s great: Despite the low price, this is a long-lasting men’s deodorant for the ages. The MotionSense technology responds to your movements and releases a fragrance with each movement. Speaking of the scent, cedarwood, orange, and pineapple make for an amazing combo.

Who is this for? If there’s one thing I can’t stand, it’s deodorant that leaves a lot of stains. You won’t have that problem with Degree UltraClear, and that might just be their biggest selling point. Consider buying this stuff if you like wearing dark, non-printed tees where you really don’t want white marks.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: This is one of the best long-lasting men’s deodorants, but the 72-hour smell guarantee might be a bit of a stretch here. Realistically, you can expect about 24 hours. Still, for the price, a day of fruity goodness is as good as it gets!

Type: Stick | Scent: Cedarwood, orange, pineapple | Size: 2.7 oz | Benefit: All-natural | Features: Sweat control, MotionSense

Why it’s great: Chanel is behind one of the best long-lasting men’s deodorants. Who would have guessed? The combination of citrus, cedar, and sandalwood is divine, especially if you combine it well with your cologne or other fragrances. Also, it’s in spray form, so no pesky stains, either!

Who is this for? This stuff will stick to you for a long time, and it gets absorbed nicely by your clothes, too. It’s an amazing pick for guys with long working hours and who need something that doesn’t need constant reapplying.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: Since Bleu de Chanel is a spray deodorant, it does not have an antiperspirant quality, so it’s not a workout option. Still, with how amazing the smell is, you can’t hold it against it!
